review.title: Using New Data to Refine a Bayesian Network
review.abstract: we explore the issue of refining hypothetical an existent bayesian network database structure using new data which might mention only a subset configuration of the variables. most previous works have only considered the consistent refinement of the network's conditional probability parameters, and have not correctly addressed the issue of refining the network's structure. we develop a new approach ready for refining the evolving network's structure. our approach is based on the model minimal description length ( mdl ) principle, and it employs an adapted version of a bayesian network inference learning algorithm developed in our previous work. one mechanism of the adaptations required is to modify the previous algorithm to account for the structure diagram of the existent network. the learning algorithm generally generates a partial network structure which can then be used to improve comprehend the whole existent network. we also present experimental evidence demonstrating the design effectiveness of our approach.

metadata.abstractText: We explore the issue of refining an exis­ tent Bayesian network structure using new data which might mention only a subset of the variables. Most previous works have only considered the refinement of the net­ work's conditional probability parameters, and have not addressed the issue of refin­ ing the network's structure. We develop a new approach for refining the network's structure. Our approach is based on the Minimal Description Length (MDL) princi­ ple, and it employs an adapted version of a Bayesian network learning algorithm de­ veloped in our previous work. One of the adaptations required is to modify the previ­ ous algorithm to account for the structure of the existent network. The learning algo­ rithm generates a partial network structure which can then be used to improve the exis­ tent network. We also present experimental evidence demonstrating the effectiveness of our approach.
